alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Calhoun, west central Clarendon, southwestern Sumter and central Orangeburg Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over St. Matthews, or 8 miles north of Brookdale, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Matthews, Elloree, Santee State Park, Cameron, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, Creston, Stumphole Landing, Lone Star and Low Falls Landing. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 137 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
